feedback_items.title: Inefficient file reading
feedback_items.short_desc: You only need to read your data file once.
feedback_items.long_desc: Once you read the file when the server first starts, you can then maintain the state in memory.

feedback_items.title: One save file
feedback_items.short_desc: You only need one file to store your data.
feedback_items.long_desc: It's okay to have more than one file to store your data, but it adds extra complexity. Imagine having more than 2 things to manage.

feedback_items.title: Persist before responding
feedback_items.short_desc: You should persist your data before responding.
feedback_items.long_desc: For this assignment, it's better practice to respond only after having written your data to storage, otherwise if the write goes wrong, the client wouldn't know.

feedback_items.title: Inefficient sorting
feedback_items.long_desc: The easiest method is to use JavaScript's sort() function with the right comparator. Alternatively, you could use a different data structure that's more suitable for getting the top K items, or use binary search to add items.

feedback_items.title: Retrieval of top 10 can be simplified
feedback_items.short_desc: Your retrieval of top 10 items can be streamlined.
feedback_items.long_desc: You can just simply use .slice(0, 10) on an Array to get up to 10 items.
